arts.ttl: AC Milan vs. Fiorentina: both need a response
arts.sum: This will be Stefano Pioli’s 500th Serie A match as a head coach: his record stands at 217 wins, 135 draws, and 147 defeats. For Stefano Pioli’s Fiorentina (the coach who led AC Milan to their last Scudetto) this is already a must-win: three draws so far leave the Viola desperate to finally claim three points.

arts.ttl: AC Milan vs Fiorentina – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: AC Milan and Fiorentina go head-to-head at San Siro on Sunday evening in an intriguing Serie A clash. The Rossoneri will be looking to extend their impressive unbeaten run, whilst La Viola desperately seeks their first league win of the campaign. arts.ttl: Ricci handed second opportunity to impress with starting spot in Milan-Fiorentina
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Samuele Ricci is expected to get the nod in Milan’s game against Fiorentina, and after his cameo from start against Lecce, it’s a second opportunity that he must seize. Ricci hasn’t had the best of starts to the season. Not because of his performances on the pitch, but rather because of his lack of minutes. arts.ttl: Official: Marinelli to officiate Milan vs. Fiorentina – no defeats in seven games
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Livio Marinelli has been named as the head referee for AC Milan’s clash against Fiorentina tomorrow. Looking at his record with the Rossoneri, the fans can breathe a sigh of relief. After the draw against Juventus, Milan will be looking to bounce back with a win against Fiorentina at San Siro. arts.ttl: MP: Milan forward Nkunku unavailable vs Fiorentina – The latest
arts.sum: Massimiliano Allegri is counting the unavailable players for the match against Fiorentina. Among them will most likely be Christopher Nkunku, despite the door left open by the coach in the press conference. Estupiñán and Nkunku out: expected back against Pisa.. Both the Frenchman and Pervis Estupiñán will miss the game against Fiorentina but should return […]

arts.ttl: Allegri warns Milan cannot underestimate Fiorentina: “They deserve more”
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller AC Milan will be up against Fiorentina tomorrow and during his press conference earlier today, Max Allegri warned they cannot afford to underestimate La Viola despite the poor start. Fiorentina’s start to the season has been dire, to say the least, with zero wins and just three points collected so far. Stefano Pioli is certainly […] The post Allegri warns Milan cannot underestimate Fiorentina: “They deserve more” appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: Allegri confirms three Milan players out vs. Fiorentina, one in dobut, Saelemaekers back
arts.sum: Massimiliano Allegri confirms that Christian Pulisic, Pervis Estupinan and Adrien Rabiot will miss tomorrow’s game...

arts.ttl: Terim says Milan ‘must always aim to win’ while Fiorentina will bounce back ‘soon’
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Ahead of the game between AC Milan and Fiorentina, Fatih Terim spoke to Gazzetta dello Sport, having coached both clubs in the past. The well-known Turkish manager coached Fiorentina during the 2000-01 season, but was let go before it came to an end.
